2025-10-20.content:
You can now create regional Filestore instances starting at 100 GiB and scale them in 1 GiB units. The small instances feature is available under Restricted GA in `us-central1` and `us-east4` regions.
For more information, see [Small capacity Filestore instances](https://cloud.google.com/filestore/docs/service-tiers#small-instances).

summary.title: Filestore small instances
summary.summary: You can now create regional Filestore instances starting at 100 GiB and scale them in 1 GiB units.

2025-06-04.content:
The [promoteReplica API](https://cloud.google.com/filestore/docs/reference/rest/v1/projects.locations.instances/promoteReplica) is available for promoting replicas to regular instances.
For more information, see [About instance replication](https://cloud.google.com/filestore/docs/instance-replication).

summary.title: New API available for replica promotion
summary.summary: The promoteReplica API is now available to promote replicas to regular instances. This feature enhances instance management by allowing replicas to be promoted.

2025-05-27.content: You can now use the [Filestore CSI driver](https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/docs/how-to/persistent-volumes/filestore-csi-driver) to create Filestore instances with the NFSv4.1 protocol from the Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) cluster. This feature is available for zonal, regional, and enterprise [service tiers](https://cloud.google.com/filestore/docs/service-tiers).

summary.title: Filestore CSI driver available on GKE
summary.summary: You can now create Filestore instances using the Filestore CSI driver on GKE. This supports NFSv4.1 protocol and is available across various service tiers, including zonal, regional, and enterprise.
